events.title: Magellan Navigates the Strait of Magellan
events.description: Ferdinand Magellan and his expedition successfully navigate the Strait of Magellan at the southern tip of South America, opening a new maritime route from the Atlantic to the Pacific Ocean.
events.significance: This was a crucial step in the circumnavigation of the globe and expanded European knowledge of world geography.

events.title: Establishment of the First Yugoslavia
events.description: The Kingdom of Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes is officially proclaimed, later known as Yugoslavia.
events.significance: Marked the unification of South Slavic peoples into a single state after World War I, influencing Balkan politics throughout the 20th century.

events.title: Angola Gains Independence
events.description: Angola achieves independence from Portugal after a protracted liberation war.
events.significance: It signified the end of Portuguese colonial rule in Angola and led to a significant realignment in African geopolitics.

events.title: New Zealand Grants Women the Right to Stand for Parliament
events.description: New Zealand passes legislation allowing women to stand for election to Parliament, becoming a leader in women's political rights.
events.significance: Advanced gender equality and women's suffrage movements globally.
